sections.description: The Laam in the definite article 'Al-' (الـ) is either pronounced clearly (Qamariyyah) or silent/merged (Shamsiyyah), depending on the letter that follows.

subtypes.description: The Laam is PRONOUNCED clearly with sukoon. Occurs before 14 'moon' letters.
subtypes.letters: ا ب ج ح خ ع غ ف ق ك م و هـ ي

examples.translation: All praise is for Allah, Lord of the worlds
examples.rule_applied: Laam Qamariyyah — Laam pronounced, followed by Haa (ح)

subtypes.description: The Laam is SILENT — written but not pronounced. It merges (Idgham) into the following letter, which gets a Shaddah. Occurs before 14 'sun' letters.
subtypes.letters: ت ث د ذ ر ز س ش ص ض ط ظ ل ن

examples.translation: The Most Gracious, The Most Merciful
examples.rule_applied: Laam Shamsiyyah — Laam silent, merged into Raa (ر)

sections.title_en: Laam of the Name of Allah
sections.description: The Laam in the name 'Allah' (الله) alternates between heavy (Tafkheem) and light (Tarqeeq) based on the vowel of the letter BEFORE it.
The letter Raa alternates between heavy (Tafkheem/Mufakhham) and light (Tarqeeq/Muraqqaq) depending on its vowel and surrounding context.

tafkheem_cases.condition: Raa has Sukoon, preceded by Fathah
Raa has Sukoon, preceded by Dammah
Raa has Sukoon, preceded by Kasrah 'Aaridah (temporary)
tafkheem_cases.note: Heavy — the Kasrah on Hamzat Al-Wasl is temporary

tafkheem_cases.condition: Raa has Sukoon, preceded by Sukoon after Fathah/Dammah

tarqeeq_cases.condition: Raa has Sukoon, preceded by Kasrah Asliyyah (original)
Raa has Sukoon, preceded by Yaa Maddiyyah
